intro: Geraniospermum carinatum, commonly known as the hairy geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a resilient species suitable for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
